sen.j: 慧灌（えかん、生没年不詳）は、飛鳥時代に高句麗から渡来した僧。
sen.e: Ekan (date of birth and death unknown) was a Buddhist priest from Goguryeo who came to Japan in the Nara period.
Ekan (date of birth and death unknown) was a Buddhist priest who came to Japan from Goguryeo in the Nara period.
sen.cmt: 「a Buddhist priest from Goguryeo who came to Japan」 → 『a Buddhist priest who came to Japan from Goguryeo』に修正しました。
sen.e: Ekan (date of birth and death unknown) was a Buddhist priest who came to Japan from Goguryeo in the Nara period.
He was the founder of the Sanron Sect.
He was the founder of the Sanron Sect.
He was the founder of the Sanron Sect.

sen.j: 慧灌は吉蔵に師事して三論教学を学んだ。
sen.e: Ekan had Yoshizo as his teacher and studied the San-lun Teachings.
Ekan learned the San-lun Teachings from Yoshizo.
sen.cmt: 「Ekan had Yoshizo as his teacher and studied the San-lun Teachings.」 → 『Ekan learned the San-lun Teachings from Yoshizo.』に修正しました。
sen.e: Ekan learned the San-lun Teachings from Yoshizo.

sen.j: 625年（推古33年）高句麗王の貢上により来日し、三論宗を伝え、勅命により元興寺に住した。
sen.e: In 625, the king of Goguryeo sent Ekan to Japan and he spread the teachings of Sanron Sect and had the imperial order to live in the Ganko-ji Temple.
In 625, the king of Goguryeo sent Ekan to Japan and he spread the teachings of Sanron Sect and had the imperial order to live in the Ganko-ji Temple.
sen.cmt: 「and had the imperial order to live in the Ganko-ji Temple.」 → 『lived in the Ganko-ji Temple by an imperial order.』に変更しました。
sen.e: In 625, the king of Goguryeo sent Ekan to Japan and he spread the teachings of Sanron Sect and had the imperial order to live in the Ganko-ji Temple.

sen.j: 同じ年の夏は旱魃となり、その際、三論を講じて僧正に任じられたというが、一説によれば孝徳天皇のときに僧正に任じられたともいう。
sen.e: One view states that he became the highest ranking monk by preaching the Three Shastras when people suffered from drought that summer, whereas others believe it was Emperor Kotoku who offered him the position.

One view states that he became the highest ranked monk by preaching the Three Shastras when people suffered from drought in the summer of that year, whereas others believe it was Emperor Kotoku who offered him the position.
sen.cmt: ・「the highest ranking monk」 → 『the highest ranked monk』に変更しました。・「that summer」 → 『in the summer of that year 』に修正しました。
sen.e: One view states that he became the highest ranked monk by preaching the Three Shastras when people suffered from drought in the summer of that year, whereas others believe it was Emperor Kotoku who offered him the position.

sen.j: その後、河内国に井上寺（いかみじ）を建立し、三論宗を広めた。
sen.e: He later built the Ikami-ji Temple in Kawachi District and spread the teachings of Sanron Sect.
He later built the Ikami-ji Temple in Kawachi District and spread the teachings of Sanron Sect.
He later built the Ikami-ji Temple in Kawachi District and spread the teachings of Sanron Sect.

sen.j: その後、福亮や智蔵に受け継がれた。
sen.e: After Ekan, his teachings were passed on to Fukuryo and Chizo.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: After that, his teachings were passed on to Fukuryo and Chizo.
sen.cmt: ・「After」 → 『After that』に変更しました。 ・「Ekan,」を削除しました。.
sen.e: After that, his teachings were passed on to Fukuryo and Chizo.

sen.j: 智蔵は入唐し、三論教学を学び、法隆寺に住した。
sen.e: Chizo moved to China to study the San-lun Teachings and lived in the Horyu-ji Temple after he came back.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Chizo moved to China to learn the San-lun Teachings and lived in the Horyu-ji Temple after he came back.
Chizo moved to China to learn the San-lun Teachings and lived in the Horyu-ji Temple after he came back.

sen.j: その後、道慈に受け継がれ、道慈は入唐し、三論教学を学び、大安寺に住した。
sen.e: It was later passed on to Doji who moved to China and studied San-lun Teachings and lived in Daian-ji Temple after he came back.
Then Teachings were passed on to Doji who moved to China and learned the San-lun Teachings and lived in Daian-ji Temple after he came back.
sen.cmt: ・「It was later」 → 『Then, Teachings were』に変更しました。・「studied」 → 『learned』 に変更しました。
sen.e: Then Teachings were passed on to Doji who moved to China and learned the San-lun Teachings and lived in Daian-ji Temple after he came back.
